title: Two out of three U.S. adults have not completed an advance directive

title_detail.value: Two out of three U.S. adults have not completed an advance directive

summary: Advance directives are the primary tool for individuals to communicate their wishes if they become incapacitated and are unable to make their own health care decisions, particularly near the end of life. Despite this, 63 percent of American adults have not completed one, reports the most comprehensive study to date on the subject.
